ALL USD 240 Students - Food Service Announcement

The USDA made an announcement this week stating schools could provide a free breakfast and lunch to ALL students regardless of their status from now until December 31, or when the state/federal funding runs out. We have applied for the waiver and have been approved to begin providing this service to all students starting September 4. No lunch accounts will be charged until this funding source is no longer available.

We will not reimburse lunch account funds at this time as those dollars will be used once this program is over.

Because of other funding programs, we still request you complete the free/reduced application form and submit to your school as soon as possible. These reports assist in funding Title and At-Risk services and add additional dollars to our schools. Application Link: https://www.usd240.org/vimages/shared/vnews/stories/594930b04f342/20-21%20HouseholdApplication.pdf

Have a great day!

Pam Irwin

Twin Valley Usd 240
July 4 at 1:19 AM ·

Good Evening Twin Valley Family!

I am excited to be here and working with all of you to serve the students and families that are part of USD 240.

I can honestly say that I never thought I would become a Superintendent during a pandemic, but here we are :-)!

I am planning to have a virtual parent meeting on Wednesday, July 8th at 6:30 pm. I'll post on Monday or Tuesday what format the meeting will be, either Zoom or Facebook Live. I'm still trying to figure out what we have and what's best to use to coordinate our communication.

We certainly don't have all of the answers, but we would like to share where we are with our planning process for reopening schools and our work to keep both staff and students safe. We will also discuss the timeline for when we will receive the KSDE guidance, as well as when we are hopeful to have a fairly vetted plan for the opening of the 20-21 school year.

I hope you can join us for the discussion!

Happy 4th of July!

Stay safe and have a great weekend!

Pam Irwin

USD 240 Superintendent

MONDAY, NOVEMBER 4, 2019 THROUGH WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 6, 2019

We have been informed that the city of Bennington will once again be under a boil water advisory through the school day on Tuesday, November 5 2019 due to an issue with the pumps that was discovered by the city of Bennington.

According to the KDHE, all water should be boiled if it is to be used for drinking, cooking, etc. The city does not expect to have the lab results to indicate whether or not the water is safe until sometime tomorrow night, approximately no earlier than 7 or 8 pm tomorrow evening.

We plan to have school on Tuesday, November 5 as planned and will have bottled water on hand for students to drink during the day as well as in the kitchen for their cooking as we did last week.

If you do not feel comfortable sending your child to school we do understand. Please contact either the Bennington grade school or high school office if that is the case.

An announcement has been sent out to Bennington parents and staff via the school messenger system.
